Over the past couple of days, Guwahati has been the centre of media attraction as rebel MLAs from the Shiv Sena in Maharashtra have been sequestered in a hotel in the Assamese capital, under the umbrella of breakaway party leader Eknath Shinde. The rebels arrived in Assam on Wednesday after having first sought shelter in another Bharatiya Janata Party-ruled state, Gujarat.The revolt has put a question mark on the future of Maharashtra‚Äôs Maha Vikas Aghadi government, of which the Shiv Sena is a member. In Assam, state chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma was seen at the hotel in which the rebels are staying, even as scores of police personnel stood guard,The drama has unfolded even as unprecedented floods have ravaged large parts of Assam with the toll climbing to 101 on Thursday.
